subject: Cybersecurity
title: Cyber Mercenaries: Hacking for Hire
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cyber Mercenaries: Hacking for Hire usable.

hook.text: You don't need a cyber army if you can hire one. Private companies now sell hacking as a service to governments.

buildup.text: Companies like NSO Group, Hacking Team, and Dark Matter sell offensive cyber tools to governments worldwide.

discovery.text: These firms give small countries capabilities that previously only the NSA or GCHQ possessed.

twist.text: Many clients are authoritarian regimes who use these tools against journalists, activists, and political opponents.

climax.text: The cyber mercenary market democratizes surveillance power â€” for better or worse, usually worse.

punchline.text: NSA-grade spying is now available for purchase.

quiz.question: What do cyber mercenary companies like NSO Group sell?
options: Offensive hacking tools and spyware to governments
